result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Marcus L Moore
Current: 101 1st Street, Bessemer, MI 49911 United States  (Effective: 03-07-2022)
Prior: 160 Crave Rd, Waynesville, NC 28786
Def shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

09:23 AM Defendant Marcus L Moore in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video means for Defendant Marcus L Moore. Court calls case, cites app.  Complaint rcvd/rvwd.  Def waives reading.  Waives t/l for prelim only.  Motion to be addressed.  DA leaves to discretion to court, possible low cash bond.  Atty Brewer argues for bond modification.  Requests signature bond.  Def indicates does not have money to post.  Def has been in custody for over 30 days.  Court modifies to $1,000 sig bond, no possess any CTS, meth and THC,  no matter where is located.  PTC to be scheduled for 3/24 at 1:00 p.m. for PTC.  No questions.  Adj.  9:30 a.m.  klr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 02/07/22 Bond Hearing Minutes:  1:54 p.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Mathew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Public def info given to def.  Court explains what PC/Bond hearing entails.  Officer Samardich signed PC statement.  Officer Kyle Mabie sworn in, direct by DA.  Court questions Officer.  1:57 p.m.  Witness excused.  Court explains PC to def.  Court finds PC.  DA makes request for bond of $1,000 cash with conditions.  Court questions def re position on bond.  Def addresses Court.  New to community.  Working with Comm. Action.  From NC.  brother lives in Bessemer.  Court quesftions further.  Court questions DA.  Court sets bond as requested:  $1,000 cash bond, no use of CTs without prescription.  Def identified self during hearing.  Adj.  2:06 p.m.  klr
